page.title: 11Employment
page.content:
We did a survey of employment among the parents of the children at our Primary School. We found that most of the mothers of the children were housewives or did part-time work in offices or on the farm.
The males had a diversity of occupations but the largest proportion were in jobs associated with agriculture. The next highest group worked for the local authority, for example, teaching. None worked in heavy industry.
Only a very small percentage of those who replied on the questionnaire said they were unemployed.
